thoughts.text: Now that we have created the 'river_simulation.py' script, we can execute it to simulate being a river. We can use the 'execute_python_file' command to run the script.
thoughts.reasoning: We have created the 'river_simulation.py' script using the 'write_to_file' command. To simulate being a river, we need to execute the script. The 'execute_python_file' command will allow us to run the script.
thoughts.plan: - Use the 'execute_python_file' command to run the 'river_simulation.py' script
thoughts.criticism: I should have included a timestamp in the filename of the output file so that I can easily distinguish between different runs of the 'river_simulation.py' script.
